chapter.title: Getting Started with JBoss Developer Studio

section.title: Welcome to JBoss Developer Studio
section.para: In this section we'll show you how to work with the welcome page of the JBoss Developer Studio.
The welcome page is the first page you see when you first launch JBoss Developer Studio.
With the help of its page you will be able:

listitem.para: to get quick access to Getting Started Documentation (guides, tutorials and viewlets)
to create new Seam projects, jBPM Process, JSF or Struts projects using JBoss Developer Studio wizards
to get short descriptions of the perspectives that JBoss Developer Studio provides
to visit JBoss Developer Studio web resources.

section.para: You can start working with JBoss Developer Studio by clicking on the Workbench button or simply closing the Welcome page.

section.title: Upgrading
section.para: Because JBoss Developer Studio 3.0x and 4.0 use different versions of Eclipse, it is not possible to directly upgrade from an older version to JBoss Developer Studio 4.0.

note.title: Tip
note.para: It is possible to run JBoss Developer Studio 3.0x and 4.0 side by side, as long as they have been installed into separate directories.

listitem.para: Make sure JBoss Developer Studio is not running
Uninstall your current version of JBoss Developer Studio by running the Uninstaller

section.title: JBoss Central
section.para: When viewing the workbench for the first time you will be greated with JBoss Central. JBoss Central assists you in getting started and keeps you up to date with JBoss technologies.
At the top of the tab is a search box. By clicking the down arrow to the left you can select to perform a search on either the Red Hat Customer Portal or the JBoss Community.
Performing a search will launch a web browser as a new tab within JBoss Developer Studio displaying the results page. You can interact with the browser as you would any other web browser.

From the Create Projects section you can create a Dynamic Web Project, Seam 2 Web Project, Maven Project or any one of many Project Examples. To access a complete list of projects you can create, click on the window icon at the top-right of the Create Projects section
.
Under the Project Examples section you can expand and view Java EE 6 Quickstarts, JBoss AS 7 Quickstarts and Seam 2 Tutorials.

You can also download other examples and install and set runtime preferences through the Project Examples section by using the five buttons at the top-right. The first button
launches a New Project Examples wizard. Here you can search and download project examples to assist you with getting started.

By clicking on the second button
you will be taken directly to the JBoss Tools Runtime Detection dialog within Preferences.

The third
and fourth
buttons take you directly to the Seam 2 runtime and Server Runtime Environments preference dialogs respectively.

The final button
refreshes the Project Examples list.
If you do not wish to see JBoss Central at every startup, you can deselect the checkbox Show on Startup in the Settings section.
